title: Is July 9th letter Tamala Krishna Goswamiâ€™s? | Sri Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Srila Prabhupada, on 9th of July, 1977, issued a written directive to the whole of ISKCON, detailing a Rithvik system of initiations to be followed in ISKCON.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the July 9th Directive, explaining its context and purpose regarding the Rithvik system of initiations.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Goswami claimed that the July 9th letter was his letter, not Srila Prabhupada's.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Tamal Krishna Goswami's later claim that he authored the July 9th letter and the implications for the current Guru system in ISKCON.

segments.key_quote: If this was Tamalkrishna Goswami's letter, then the question comes, who appointed the 11 people as Ritwiks?
segments.summary: The speaker argues that even if the July 9th Directive was written by Tamal Krishna Goswami, he lacked the authority to appoint Ritviks or direct the GBC, thus reinforcing the directive's origin from Srila Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: The GBC resolution number 16 of 1978 stated, the GBC will consider each year at Gaurapurnima the appointment of new spiritual masters to be approved by a three-fourth vote.
segments.summary: The speaker analyzes GBC resolution number 16 from 1978, highlighting the claim that Srila Prabhupada selected the 11 Gurus and questioning why Tamal Krishna Goswami didn't object if he believed the letter was his own.

segments.key_quote: So, are these 11 Gurus appointed by Tamalkrishna Goswami?
segments.summary: The speaker continues to question the implications of disowning the July 9th Directive, suggesting it implies the 11 Gurus were appointed by Tamal Krishna Goswami and questioning ISKCON's current direction.

segments.key_quote: ISKCON, GBC, in fact, contradicted their resolution number 16 of 1978 later on.
segments.summary: The speaker points out the contradictions between the GBC's 1978 resolution and their later confession in 1999 regarding the unauthorized zonal acharya system.

segments.key_quote: The GBC body allowed for elevating 11 exclusive successor diksha gurus.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the GBC's admission that they elevated the 11 successor diksha gurus, questioning their authority to do so and labeling the entire diksha guru system in ISKCON as unauthorized.

segments.key_quote: Tamal Krishna Goswami's duty to put it in writing and inform everyone about Srila Prabhupada's order.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reaffirming the July 9th Directive as Srila Prabhupada's order, urging devotees to follow it and reject the claims of self-appointed Gurus, advocating for the Rittvik system.
